item.title: College wrestling: Panel approves rules changes for correcting in-match timing errors
item.description: The NCAA Playing Rules Oversight Panel on Tuesday approved wrestling rules changes that allow the referee to correct timing errors when that referee has reasonable knowledge of the correction that needs to be made.

item.title: The college careers of the 2021 US Olympic wrestlers
item.description: Here's a close look at the collegiate careers of the men's freestyle, women's freestyle and men's Greco-Roman 2021 Olympic team members.

item.title: College wrestling: Committee modifies rules for correcting in-match timing errors
item.description: The NCAA Wrestling Rules Committee recommended that when referees have positive knowledge of a timing error, they may use an established rules protocol to make the appropriate correction.

item.title: Dan Hodge Trophy: History, winners, and how it works
item.description: Here's the history of the Dan Hodge Trophy, named after one of the all-time greats and given annually to the top college wrestler every year since 1985.

item.title: Oklahoma State's AJ Ferrari vs. Pitt's Nino Bonaccorsi (197 pounds)
item.description: Oklahoma State's AJ Ferrari wrestles Pitt's Nino Bonaccorsi for the 197 pound title at the 2021 NCAA wrestling championships.

item.title: Penn State's Aaron Brooks vs NC State's Trent Hidlay (184 pounds)
item.description: Penn State's Aaron Brooks wrestles NC State's Trent Hidlay for the 184 pound title at the 2021 NCAA wrestling championships.

item.title: Iowa's Michael Kemerer vs. Penn State's Carter Starocci (174 pounds)
item.description: Iowa's Michael Kemerer vs. Penn State's Carter Starocci wrestle in the 174 pound final at the 2021 NCAA wrestling champinships

item.title: Rider’s Jesse Dellavecchia vs. Iowa State’s David Carr (157 pounds)
item.description: Rider's Jesse Dellavecchia wrestles Iowa State's David Carr for the 157-pound national title at the 2021 NCAA wrestling championships.

item.title: 2021 DI wrestling finals: Sammy Sasso vs. Austin O'Connor (149 pounds)
item.description: Ohio State's Sammy Sasso wrestles North Carolina's Austin O'Connor for the 149-pound national title at the 2021 NCAA wrestling championships.

item.title: Watch highlights from every match of the 2021 Wrestling Championship finals
item.description: There's a new king of the mountain in wrestling as Iowa's Spencer Lee caps the Hawkeyes' 24th team title with his third individual title and Penn State goes four-for-four in their finals matches at the 2021 DI Wrestling Championship finals.

item.title: 2021 DI wrestling finals: Jaydin Eierman vs. Nick Lee (141 pounds)
item.description: Iowa's Jaydin Eierman wrestles Penn State's Nick Lee for the 141-pound national title at the 2021 NCAA wrestling championships.

item.title: 2021 DI wrestling finals: Daton Fix vs. Roman Bravo-Young (133 pounds)
item.description: Oklahoma State's Daton Fix wrestles Penn State's Roman Bravo-Young for the 133-pound national title at the 2021 NCAA wrestling championships.

item.title: 2021 DI wrestling finals: Spencer Lee vs. Brandon Courtney (125 pounds)
item.description: Iowa's Spencer Lee wrestles Arizona State's Brandon Courtney for the 125-pound national title at the 2021 NCAA wrestling championships.

item.title: 2021 DI wrestling finals: Minnesota's Gable Steveson vs. Michigan's Mason Parris (285 pounds)
item.description: Minnesota's Gable Steveson wrestles Michigan's Mason Parris for the 2021 DI wrestling national championship at 285 pounds.

item.title: 2021 DI wrestling finals: Shane Griffith vs. Jake Wentzel (165 lbs.)
item.description: Shane Griffith of Stanford wrestles Jake Wentzel of Pittsburgh for the 165-pound national title at the 2021 NCAA Wrestling Championships.

item.title: Jake Wentzel recaps his career highlights in a 'Dear Wrestling' letter
item.description: Jake Wentzel explains how wrestling for Pittsburgh has helped him build his confidence and work ethic.

item.title: Meet the 2021 NCAA college wrestling All-Americans
item.description: Only 80 NCAA wrestlers earn this prestigious award every year, so let's meet the eight guys in each of the ten weight classes who earned their spots on the podium.

item.title: Korbin Myers expresses his love for wrestling in a letter to the sport
item.description: "As my career comes to an end, I can truly say that, if I could, I would do it all over again," Korbin Myers said, as he thanks the sport that built him in a heartfelt letter.

item.title: Get ready for the 2021 Wrestling Championships in St. Louis
item.description: Get ready for the drama of the 2021 NCAA DI Wrestling Championships where the best in the sport will battle for individual glory and Iowa will look to reclaim their place at the top of the sport.

item.title: Sebastian Rivera might be the next, perfect, Rutgers wrestling champion
item.description: Sebastian Rivera is an ideal, Jersey-bred candidate to be head coach Scott Goodale’s next national champion at 141 pounds.
